history.content: Personally, 170, 16A, and two breadths does not seem light at all. To be honest, I would even consider 170, 16A, and one breadth for myself. If you are looking to prepare for 16B, taking 16A for a letter grade so you try your best instead of half-trying in a P/NP setting seems better. 170 has weekly problem sets that are very time consuming even for the smartest of students, taking on average 20+/hrs week, and 16A homeworks also has weekly problem sets that take a decent amount of time as well. This combination of double weekly problem sets could get troublesome if you are looking to be heavily involved in Fall recruiting.

"All courses taken for the major must be taken for a letter grade. Students must complete all the lower division course requirements with a passing letter grade to graduate."

Not sure if you can take EE 16A P/NP unless you entered before Fall 2017 in which you can do Math 54 and EE 16B to satisfy the lower division requirement. Personally, 170, 16A, and two breadths does not seem light at all. To be honest, I would even consider 170, 16A, and one breadth for myself. If you are looking to prepare for 16B, taking 16A for a letter grade so you try your best instead of half-trying in a P/NP setting seems better. 170 has weekly problem sets that are very time consuming even for the smartest of students, taking on average 20+/hrs week, and 16A homeworks also has weekly problem sets that take a decent amount of time as well. This combination of double weekly problem sets could get troublesome if you are looking to be heavily involved in Fall recruiting.

children.subject: Sorry you are correct you can take either 16A or 54, but 16A is the best preparer for 16B.

Under the students admitted Fall 2017 and after section it says 16A or 54. I was under the impression that if I took 54 for the letter grade I could take 16A effectively as an elective. Thanks for the advice, the weekly problem set was something I hadn't considered.

history.content:
Took 54, trying to take 16A p/np so I don't get wrecked in 16B. Really want to take 170, but if I just take 170 and 16A p/np with two breadths it'll be pretty light. Wondering if those two plus 160 and an easy breadth is too much. I'm thinking the first half of 16A will be pretty fine with 54 experience, but it might get a little hairy at the end. 

I considered 47D but I figured at that point I might as well take 16A full stop and get the easy(ish) points at the start as a buffer.
history.subject: EE16A p/np + 160 + 170
